Description: Fragment of rim and neck of probably North Ionian pottery krater, with scar of handle on underside. Cream slip. Interior glazed; on top of lip frieze of alternating stopt maeander and large rosettes in squares; billets on outside of lip, underside glazed; band at top of neck and minimal remains of probable floral below.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1110)
